intro: Lampocarya, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. The plants are characterized by their dense, often silver-gray foliage and showy yellow to orange flowers. They are typically shrubs or small trees, adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Lampocarya species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
